reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our fourth visit to Southern Italy and the first to Sicily. Beautiful Il Limoneto is ideally placed, set in acres of lemon trees with views of the sea in one direction and Mount Etna in the other. Fabrizio and Veronica are excellent hosts, attentive without being intrusive. The evenings spent at one of their set meals for guests were gastronomic highlights. Accommodation is simple, attractive and comfortable with good outdoor facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last month we returned to Il Limoneto, after having stayed there two years ago during our previous vacation in Sicily. We already remembered Il Limoneto as the most beautiful, peaceful and hospitable place we visited then (during a 3,5 week holiday on which we also visited places like Agrigento, Ragusa, Palermo, Siracusa, Taormina, Catania and Piazza Armerina), but when we came back last month, it turned out that the reality of Il Limoneto was even better than our memory of it.
reviews.title: Great setting among lemon groves with view of Etna.

reviews.text: The agriturismo is beautifully situated between the sea on one side and Mount Etna on the other, with views that never cease to captivate. The apartments are simple but very spacious and comfortable. They are located among the lemon trees, so that you really feel part of the peace and quiet of the grounds, having an almost immediate effect of relaxation.

aka: Agriturismo Il Limoneto Acireale, Sicily - Province Of Catania
description: Il Limoneto is a traditional farmhouse right in the heart of the Ionian coast, commonly known as the “Riviera dei Limoni”.It expands for over more than 4 hectares and is surrounded by a flourishing green terraced lemon orchard. From here you can admire the wonderful landscape and take a glimpse at its rare beauty, from Etna to the Ionian Sea and the rich nature reserve called “La Timpa” an area of natural beauty and dipped in a splendid garden of lemons and typical flowers of the Mediterranean.Today, after six generations, our family continue to produce “organic” lemons alongside with the Farmhouse activity. Accomodation is offered in the ancient manor house, cottages and a recently built dependence situated on old vineyard, overlooking the sea and Mount Etna.
